articles.title: DPRK FM and His Party Leave for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK FM and His Party Leave for Russia
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and his party left here today to visit Russia.
					 They were seen off at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK, China Cooperate in Different Fields
articles.content:
DPRK, China Cooperate in Different Fields
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The 4th meeting of the DPRK-China intergovernmental committee for cooperation in the economy, trade and science and technology was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall here on Tuesday.
					 Present there were DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ku Pon Thae and officials concerned and members of the Chinese government economic and trade delegation headed by Wang Chao, assistant minister of Commerce, and Charge d'Affaires ad Interim of the Chinese embassy here Hao Xiaofei.
					
					 The meeting dealt with the matters of boosting the cooperation in the economy and science and technology and expanding the trade relations between the two countries.

articles.title: DPRK-Mongolian Inter-governmental Plan for Cultural Exchange Signed
articles.content:
DPRK-Mongolian Inter-governmental Plan for Cultural Exchange Signed
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A 2009-2011 inter-governmental plan for cultural exchange was signed between the DPRK and Mongolia in Ulan Bator on Oct. 8.
					 Present there were members of the friendship delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries led by Vice-Chairman Jon Yong Jin, and the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia from the DPRK side and Minister Yo. Otgonbayar and Vice-Minister S. Tumur-Ochir of Education, Culture and Science and officials concerned from the Mongolian side.
					
					 The plan was inked by Jon Yong Jin and Yo. Otgonbayar.

articles.title: Kim Jung Rin Meets Leading Members of Chinese Art Troupe
articles.content:
Kim Jung Rin Meets Leading Members of Chinese Art Troupe
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with leading members of a Shenzhen children's art troupe of China led by Li Yizhen, secretary of the Shenzhen City Educational Commission who is member of the Standing Committee of the Shenzhen City Committee of the Communist Party of China, at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace today.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation and Art Troupe Here
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation and Art Troupe Here
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A Chinese government economic and trade delegation headed by Wang Chao, assistant minister of Commerce, arrived here Monday to attend the 4th meeting of the Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Economy, Trade, Science and Technology between the DPRK and China.
					 A Shenzhen children's art troupe of China led by Li Yizhen, secretary of the Shenzhen City Educational Commission who is member of the Standing Committee of the Shenzhen City Committee of the Communist Party of China, arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: S. Korean Visiting Group Here
articles.content:
S. Korean Visiting Group Here
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A visiting group of the "Yun I Sang Peace Foundation" of south Korea headed by Director Sin Kye Ryun arrived here Tuesday by air to attend the 27th Yun I Sang concert.

articles.title: Anniversary of Opening of Diplomatic Relations between DPRK and Russia Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Opening of Diplomatic Relations between DPRK and Russia Observed
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition of Russia was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cultural Centre on Tuesday under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Russian embassy here and the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Russia.
					 On display at the exhibition hall were photos showing the historic external activities conducted by President Kim Il Sung, the meetings of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, former Russian president, and Kim Jong Il's visit to Russia and other photos introducing Russia.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the committee who is chairwoman of the association, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and staff members of different embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 Speakers said that over the past six decades since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Russia the peoples of the two countries have made positive efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations in line with their common wishes and desire.
					
					 They noted that the photo exhibition clearly showed the undying feats performed by the top leaders of the DPRK and Russia in developing the bilateral friendly relations and successes made by the Russian people.
					
					 They stressed that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Russia are developing on good terms as the days go by under the deep care of Kim Jong Il and Russian President Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev.
					
					 The participants looked round the exhibited photos.
					
					 A film show took place at the Chollima House of Culture that day on the same occasion. 
					
					 Its participants watched the Russian feature film "The Irony of Fate" (continuation).

articles.title: German Exhibition of Bear Sculptures Held
articles.content:
German Exhibition of Bear Sculptures Held
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of bear sculptures was held at the Moranbong Youth Park on Tuesday under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Pyongyang City People's Committee, the German embassy here and the DPRK-Germany Friendship Association on the occasions of the 60th birthday of the DPRK and the national day of Germany.
					 Attending the exhibition were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the above-said committee who is  chairwoman of the DPRK-Germany Friendship Association, Kim Jong Sik, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned, working people in the city, German Ambassador to the DPRK Thomas Schafer and staff members of his embassy and the manager of the Buddy Bear Berlin GmbH of Germany and his party.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of different countries, staff members of various embassies and staff members of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers noted that the holding of the above-said exhibition in Pyongyang indicates that the friendly and cultural relations between the two countries are developing favorably.

articles.title: British Figure Visits Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
British Figure Visits Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, visited the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) Tuesday.
					 Staff members of the mission including its Chief Jo Il Min greeted the guest and had a friendly talk with him.
					
					 Jo said that many organizations for studying the Songun politics came into being against the backdrop of the south Korean people's deepening reverence for General Secretary Kim Jong Il and diverse activities are under way to support and study the Songun politics and widely introduce it.
					
					 He referred to the vigorous struggle waged by the south Korean people to preserve and implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 Dermot Hudson expressed full support to the AINDF and the south Korean people in their just cause of achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 At the end of the talk the chairman watched a multi media "Struggle is not over" introducing the south Korean people's struggle against the U.S. and the "government".

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy did friendship work at the DPRK-Cuba friendship Hwasong Cooperative Farm in Ryongsong District, Pyongyang, on Oct. 14.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice threshing and, during break, had a talk with officials of the farm.
					
					 Hoping that the farm would achieve greater successes in agricultural production in the future, the ambassador said that they would strive to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between Cuba and the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Judoists Prove Successful at Int'l Games
articles.content:
DPRK Judoists Prove Successful at Int'l Games
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK women judoists bagged a trophy cup, two gold medals, three silver medals and seven bronze medals at the 3rd East-Asian Judo Championships and the 3rd Chinese Taipei International Judo Games.
					 The games held in Chinese Taipei in September brought together judoists from various countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					 DPRK women judoists won the title of the championships and the cup by beating the teams of Chinese Taipei, south Korea and China. Hwang Chun Gum snatched a gold medal in the women's individual games in the 63kg category.
					
					 Choe Kyong Sil placed first in the women's individual games of the 63kg category of the Chinese Taipei International Judo Games.

articles.title: Sphere of Standardization Expands
articles.content:
Sphere of Standardization Expands
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A sphere of standardization is steadily expanding in the DPRK.
					New dimensions are added to standardization today to cover the overall sphere of social life encompassing economic management, information technology and public catering and service and it is playing an ever greater role.
					
					In recent years, the application of state standards to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, the flowers of the sun, was carried out in a short period in response to the earnest desire of all the people of the country and progressives of the world. 
					
					This provided a firm legal guarantee for eternally keeping alive the progenitorial characteristics of Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia and preserving them as immortal flowers and celebrated flowers of praise to the great men carrying the desire of humankind in the era of independence. 
					
					With the standardization of medicine production and quality control, it has become possible to meet on a high level the hygienic and safety requirements in the construction of medicine production bases, preparations for production, manufacturing processes and treatment of products. And state standards in social life such as the standards of signboards of buildings and doorplates of dwelling houses and standards in many other sectors including library information and environmental protection have been instituted. 
					
					Several hundred standards have been applied to such foodstuffs as processed soy-bean, soft drinks, basic foods and such national dishes as tangogi soup, sinsollo and Pyongyang cold noodle.
					
					A lot of successes have been reported in renewing old standards in various areas to suit the present conditions. 
					
					The state has examined the standards of industrial products and medicines on an overall scale and renewed, revised or supplemented them.
					
					On the other hand, it has mated the standards in many fields such as IT and basic sciences and those of quality and environmental control and food safety to international standards.
					
					Ri Ho Sop, head of the State Standardization Institute under the State Administration for Quality Management, told KCNA on the occasion of World Standard Day (October 14) that the institute would direct more efforts to continue to expand the sphere of standardization, strengthen cooperation with the International Standardization Organization and take an active part in the global standardization activities.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Sanguinary "Punitive Operation" in 1920
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Sanguinary "Punitive Operation" in 1920
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists had committed all sorts of crimes, pursuing the pernicious colonial rule during their occupation of Korea by force of arms for 40-odd years in the first half of the 20th century. Gravest was the crime that they massacred Koreans en masse in cold-blooded way.
					The brutal "punitive operation" in Jiandao is well illustrative of the brutality, cruelty and viciousness of the Japanese imperialists' genocide against the Korean people.
					
					In October 1920 they mobilized huge amounts of armed forces including the troops which had been dispatched to Siberia, a regiment under the 19th Division stationed in Korea and police corps of North and South Hamgyong Provinces under the cloak of "protecting the lives and properties of the Japanese residents in Jiandao" and slew Korean people, combing out the land of Jiandao.
					
					They, therefore, turned Hunchun, Wangqing, Helong and other counties of Jilin Province, China where Koreans lived into a sea of blood.
					
					This was the brutal "punitive operation" in the year of Kyongsin, which is known as the history of bloodshed.
					
					The Japanese imperialists took all the villages where Koreans resided as the targets of the "punitive operation". The aggressors set their houses and schools on fire and shot, beat, bayoneted and burnt all people to death irrespective of all ages and both sexes.
					
					Furthermore, they did not hesitate to commit such nefarious brutalities as gouging out eyeballs of living persons, dismembering their limbs, burying scores of people alive, chopping them into pieces and taking innocent babies from mother's breasts and throwing them into flames.
					
					In a matter of 15 days of the "punitive operation", more than 6,000 houses of Koreans were destroyed or burnt down and over 30,000 Koreans slaughtered.
					
					And at least 200,000 Koreans were left without shelter.
					
					The slaughtered people there were all those who went to an alien land in search of livelihood from their dear native places owing to the Japanese imperialists' harsh suppression and colonial predatory policy.
					
					The "punitive operation" is an outcome of the blood-thirsty Japanese imperialists' policy of obliterating the Korean nation and is a historical evidence disclosing their murderous nature and crimes in all nakedness.
					
					Such genocides perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists in the past must be dealt with without fail in accordance of the international laws.

articles.title: Candlelight Struggle Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Struggle Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A candlelight struggle against traitor Lee Myung Bak's unpopular policy was staged in Seoul on Oct. 11.
					 It was attended by people from all walks of life including members of civic and public organizations, workers, students, religionists, artistes and housewives.
					
					 Shown at the rally first was a video dealing with the struggle against the import of American beef staged in the area of Kwanghwamun in Seoul bright with candlelight.
					
					 Speakers at the rally recalled that the leading members of the People's Measure Council have been on an indomitable sit-in strike for a hundred days at the Jogye Temple though they are wanted by the police.
					
					 They declared they would not step back even an inch from their action unless Lee Myung Bak sincerely comes out for dialogue with the people.
					
					 Meanwhile, a "youth and children candlelight cultural event" was held at Chonggye Square in protest against the unjust educational policy of the puppet authorities.
					
					 Then followed a candlelight rally attended by Internet organizations including the "Anti-2MB meaning Lee Myung Bak."
					
					 The participants declared that people from all walks of life would unite as one and organize a new solidarity organization for democracy and people's living and fight against the above-said policy of the authorities.
					
					 The participants staged a sit-in strike with candlelight in their hands till the dawn of the next day.

articles.title: WPK Birthday Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK Birthday Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Bulgaria, Switzerland and France between Oct. 4 and 7 to mark the 63rd anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the first anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration.
					 Reports and speeches were made at the meetings.
					
					 Vasilka Nikiforova, chief of the Kim Il Sung Library, and other speakers at the meeting in Bulgaria highly praised the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in founding the WPK and strengthening and developing it.
					
					 They noted that under the leadership of the WPK, an invincible revolutionary party, the DPRK has turned into the socialist state centered on the popular masses where the Juche idea has been thoroughly embodied in all realms of social life and into the political and ideological and military power where the single-minded unity of the whole society has been achieved.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, lauded Kim Il Sung's feats performed in founding the party and the state, saying that he is the founder of the WPK and father of socialist Korea.
					
					 Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, noted that Kim Jong Il formulated the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo put forward by Kim Il Sung as main content of the three charters for national reunification and has wisely led the Korean people's struggle for national reunification, thus bringing about the unprecedented advance in the accomplishment of the cause of Korea's reunification.
					
					 Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that over the past more than six decades the WPK has always emerged victorious thanks to the wise and tested leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and to the Juche idea, the great guiding idea of the era of independence it has regarded as its steadfast guidelines.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Bulgaria and Switzerland.

articles.title: Parte Pak Ui Chun para visitar Rusia
articles.content:
Parte Pak Ui Chun para visitar Rusia
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- Partieron el dia 14 de esta capital el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y su comitiva para visitar Rusia.
					En el aeropuerto los despidieron el vicecanciller coreano Kung Sok Ung y el embajador de la Federacion Rusa en Corea, Valery Sukhinin.

articles.title: 4a sesion de comite de cooperacion entre Corea y China
articles.content:
4a sesion de comite de cooperacion entre Corea y China
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 14 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae la IV sesion del Comite de Cooperacion Economica, Comercial, Cientifica y Tecnica entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China.
					En la ocasion participaron el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae y otros funcionarios coreanos, los miembros de la delegacion economica y comercial del gobierno chino presidida por el ministro asistente de Comercio Wang Chao, y el encargado de negocios a. i. de China en Corea Hao Xiaofei.
					
					En la reunion se discutieron los problemas de fortalecer la cooperacion economica, cientifico y tecnica y ampliar las relaciones comerciales entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Rubricado plan de intercambio cultural entre Corea y Mongolia
articles.content:
Rubricado plan de intercambio cultural entre Corea y Mongolia
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo suscrito el dia 8 en Ulan Bator el plan de intercambio cultural para 2009-2011 entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de Mongolia.
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion de amistad del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero presidida por su vicepresidente Jon Yong Jin y el embajador de la RPDC en Mongolia y por la mongolesa, el ministro y el viceministro de Educacion, Cultura y Ciencia Yo. Otgonbayar y S. Tumur-Ochir y otros funcionarios.
					
					Jon Yong Jin y Yo. Otgonbayar firmaron el documento.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada cubana realizan trabajo de amistad
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada cubana realizan trabajo de amistad
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- El embajador, Jose Manuel Galego Montano, y otros miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea realizaron el dia 14 trabajo de amistad en la Granja Cooperativa de Hwasong de Amistad Corea-Cuba del capitalino municipio de Ryongsong.
					Los huespedes trillaron el arroz junto con los granjeros y departieron con los funcionarios de la granja en hora de descanso.
					
					El embajador cubano deseo que la granja logre en lo adelante mayores exitos en la produccion agricola y ratifico que se esforzara activamente por desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Cuba y Corea.
